text: Well those are great unis. I think it's good to have a backup (i.e somewhere with lower grades), however, i found that my uni accepted me anyway (I didn't quite get the grades I needed!). I know UCL is super competitive though.... but it's an amazing uni and I've only heard good things about it.
You can have a mix of realism and optimism in your uni choices!
No worries, send me your statement whenever you want.
Ah cute! My dog is a labradoodle - he is AMAZING.
Have you had a part time job to include on your CV/personal statement?

To be honest, UCL was one of the few unis that didn’t require certain A Level subjects for architecture (like Art, Product Design, Maths, Physics etc.) — as long as my grades are good and I have an outstanding personal statement/portfolio I can get in (very rare chance I think :sob:) 

My biggest fault was at the end of year 11 I wasn’t sure if I still wanted to do architecture because my mum discouraged me a little bit. So, when I chose my A Level options I did whatever I was confident with. But I couldn’t choose Art and Geography because they were in the same category, so I sacrificed art because geography would “open more doors” for me. 
Long story short: I started with 3 A Levels but half way during year 12 I picked up Art again because I decided I did want to get into architecture but needed subjects relevant to the course :white_frowning_face: 

I shall look at Goldsmith. I chose my uni options according to the proximity from my home, so I’ll see if it is suitable for me :slightly_smiling_face:
And nope :white_frowning_face: no work experience or jobs etc
I’m thinking about taking a gap year. I might get work experience/part time job and take a break from all the school stress, maybe do something architecture related or expand my portfolio
Also I’m sorry if I overloaded you with information, I should be doing more of the questioning :sweat_smile:
